page.title: 04FARMING 2. LAND UTILIZATION
page.content: On page3 we have seen the reasons for mixed "family" farming. Let us now examine what may be seen on the land in 1985. Cereal crops predominate the fertile ground; wheat and barley. More recently, however, "oil seed rape" has been introduced. This valuable source of vegetable oil is profitable and the fields of bright yellow will be a feature of the landscape for some time to come. Where the land is unsuitable for crops, cattle and sheep are past_ ured. Horses and ponies are also to be seen thus explaining the occasional fields of hay. Root crops such as potatoes & turnips are also grown. Where the soil is unsuitable for the plough, steep ground/patches of thick glacial drift, areas of mixed woodland are left, often providing windbreaks. Farms mechanized:tractors,combines,etc
